channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11998] Document a workflow for cherry-picking a fix to a different branch
item.description: We are not all git experts and it will be helpful to have a workflow documented, understanding that there are about a million ways to do everything in git.
item.summary: Document a workflow for cherry-picking a fix to a different branch

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Maybe Sean Busbey can take a look.

This message is automatically generated.

You mean branch here ".... intended patch."

This <command>git pull</command> should be <command>git pull --rebase</command> to update the branch you are to cherry-pick against

Yeah, this is a Sean Busbey one or to put it another way, it does not agree with his patch describing how devs should apply contribs (git apply....). The two suggestions should align I'd say.
Incorporated feedback and merged info from HBASE-11937 here.

This message is automatically generated.

do a <command>git pull</command> command,

This should be either git pull --rebase or git fetch followed by git rebase. Generally I prefer fetch/rebase, but it'll be longer to explain. This is generally true where ever we have git pull listed. Might be better to just say "make sure your local branch has all remote changes" and add a brief paragraph that explains how to do that.

+ <para>One thing you will notice with these examples is that there
+ are a lot of <command>git pull</command> commands. The only
+ command that actually writes anything to the remote repository
+ is <command>git push</command>, and you need to make absolutely
+ sure you have the correct versions of everything and don't have
+ any conflicts before pushing. The extra <command>git
+ pull</command> commands are usually redundant, but better
+ safe than sorry.</para>

Worth pointing out that if you don't have all the changes, the push will fail? Maybe with an example and a warning to update locally rather than do a force push?

FIx this on commit:

Jira to link to the change in Subversion (use the issue's

Should be git?

Fix this 'you can reuser the'

You didn't finish the line here ... will start with a line that looks like </para>

This is a really great patch. Need to post on dev list once it lands in refguide so all committers live by it. Let me know when its up on site so can refer to it and I'll do it or you do (they'll probably listen to you more @misty)
Addressed all feedback. This is what I will commit.
